title: Electric current - current and electrons in a wire

content.description: Electrons move through a wire that has a potential difference between its two ends. The electric potential becomes higher from the right end to the left end of the wire, as shown in the figure. What are the directions of both the current and the net motion of electrons in the wire?
content.question: CurrentNet Electron MotionATo the rightTo the rightBTo the rightTo the leftCTo the leftTo the rightDTo the leftTo the left

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
